DataElement.preferredName: Stable Therapeutic Corticosteroid Regimen Five Day Prior to Baseline Magnetic Resonance Imaging Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the patient was maintained on a stable corticosteroid regimen for five days prior to the baseline MRI.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stable Therapeutic Corticosteroid Treatment Regimen Five Day Prior Baseline Magnetic Resonance Imaging
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change._Any steroid hormone made in the adrenal cortex (the outer part of the adrenal gland). They are also made in the laboratory. Corticosteroids have many different effects in the body, and are used to treat many different conditions. They may be used as hormone replacement, to suppress the immune system, and to treat some side effects of cancer and its treatment. Corticosteroids are also used to treat certain lymphomas and lymphoid leukemias._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._Earlier in time or order._A starting point to which things may be compared._Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.:Any steroid hormone made in the adrenal cortex (the outer part of the adrenal gland). They are also made in the laboratory. Corticosteroids have many different effects in the body, and are used to treat many different conditions. They may be used as hormone replacement, to suppress the immune system, and to treat some side effects of cancer and its treatment. Corticosteroids are also used to treat certain lymphomas and lymphoid leukemias.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

Concepts.definition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.

Any steroid hormone made in the adrenal cortex (the outer part of the adrenal gland). They are also made in the laboratory. Corticosteroids have many different effects in the body, and are used to treat many different conditions. They may be used as hormone replacement, to suppress the immune system, and to treat some side effects of cancer and its treatment. Corticosteroids are also used to treat certain lymphomas and lymphoid leukemias.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

Property.preferredName: Five Day Prior Baseline Magnetic Resonance Imaging
Property.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.:Earlier in time or order.:A starting point to which things may be compared.:Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
A starting point to which things may be compared.

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for ABTC protocol 1401 per request by J.Zhao. mc 2/3/15

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
